title: Backporting

properties.name: description
properties.value: Backporting (or porting) is the process of bringing over content from RuneScape, released after the August 2007 Archive, into Old School RuneScape. Currently, the main source of backporting by the Old School team is from a partial backup of RuneScape as it was in May 2012.[1]

content:
Originally released in RuneScape in 2011, Nex was brought into Old School RuneScape via backporting.

Backporting (or porting) is the process of bringing over content from RuneScape, released after the August 2007 Archive, into Old School RuneScape. Currently, the main source of backporting by the Old School team is from a partial backup of RuneScape as it was in May 2012.[1]

Compared to creating new content from scratch, backporting content saves development time and resources by allowing the Old School team to re-use existing assets that were created by prior developers. However, the content is not brought over to Old School as it was in RuneScape; various factors, such as how the content was originally received, as well as balancing changes to fit Old School are taken into account. For example, Nex, one of the most difficult boss fights in 2011, was rebalanced in Old School to accommodate the lack of the Summoning skill, among other changes.

Backported content is not to be confused with extracting unused content from the August 2007 Archive of RuneScape, such as the God Wars Dungeon and the quest Land of the Goblins, which were already in a near-complete state. In addition, content such as the Corporeal Beast and the Grand Exchange are not considered backports, as they were recreated from scratch rather than being backported from the May 2012 backup.

Content from after 2011 is generally not backported into the game, as Old School RuneScape takes place in the Fifth Age and the development team has expressed a strong desire to avoid introducing content from the Sixth Age into Old School RuneScape. The death of Guthix will not occur and his Edicts will remain in place, thus keeping Gielinor and Old School in the Fifth Age.[2]

Backported content[edit | edit source]

Content Release date
(OSRS) 		Release date
(RS2)
Soul Wars 6 January 2021 10 February 2009
Shooting Stars 17 March 2021 2 September 2008
Nex and the Ancient Prison 5 January 2022 10 January 2011

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. "Gielinor Gazette: March 2020." 11 March 2020. Old School RuneScape News.
  2. ↑ https://secure.runescape.com/m=news/a=12/qa-summary-07042022?oldschool=1

[[File:Fighting Nex.png|thumb|right|300px|Originally released in ''RuneScape'' in 2011, [[Nex]] was brought into ''Old School RuneScape'' via backporting.]] '''Backporting''' (or '''porting''') is the process of bringing over content from ''RuneScape'', released after the [[August 2007 Archive of RuneScape|August 2007 Archive]], into ''[[Old School RuneScape]]''. Currently, the main source of backporting by the Old School team is from a partial backup of ''RuneScape'' as it was in May 2012.{{CiteNews|author=|url=https://oldschool.runescape.wiki/w/Update:Gielinor_Gazette:_March_2020|title=Gielinor Gazette: March 2020|newsdate=11 March 2020}} Compared to creating new content from scratch, backporting content saves development time and resources by allowing the Old School team to re-use existing assets that were created by prior developers. However, the content is not brought over to Old School as it was in RuneScape; various factors, such as how the content was originally received, as well as balancing changes to fit Old School are taken into account. For example, [[Nex]], one of the most difficult boss fights in 2011, was rebalanced in Old School to accommodate the lack of the [[Summoning]] skill, among other changes. Backported content is not to be confused with extracting unused content from the [[August 2007 Archive of RuneScape]], such as the [[God Wars Dungeon]] and the [[quest]] [[Land of the Goblins]], which were already in a near-complete state. In addition, content such as the [[Corporeal Beast]] and the [[Grand Exchange]] are not considered backports, as they were recreated from scratch rather than being backported from the May 2012 backup. Content from after 2011 is generally not backported into the game, as ''Old School RuneScape'' takes place in the [[Fifth Age]] and the development team has expressed a strong desire to avoid introducing content from the {{RSL|Sixth Age}} into ''Old School RuneScape''. The {{RSL|The World Wakes|death of Guthix}} will not occur and his Edicts will remain in place, thus keeping Gielinor and ''Old School'' in the Fifth Age.https://secure.runescape.com/m=news/a=12/qa-summary-07042022?oldschool=1 ==Backported content== {|class=wikitable style="text-align:left;" !Content !Release date
